citation.article-title: Salegentibacter salinarum sp. nov., isolated from a marine solar saltern.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Salegentibacter salinarum sp. nov.
Salegentibacter salinarum (sa.li.na′rum. L. pl. gen. n. salinarum of salterns).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile rods, 0.5–0.8 μm in diameter and 1.0–5.5 μm in length.
Colonies on MA supplemented with 6 % (w/v) NaCl are circular, convex, smooth, glistening, yellow-coloured and 1.0–1.5 mm in diameter after 7 days incubation at 30 °C.
Growth occurs at 4–41 °C and pH 5.5 and in the presence of 2–17 % (w/v) NaCl.
Optimal growth is observed at 30 °C and pH 7.0–8.0 and with 8 % (w/v) NaCl.
The Mg2+ ion is required for growth.
Growth does not occur under anaerobic conditions.
Aesculin, l-tyrosine, Tween 60 and Tween 80 are hydrolysed, but hypoxanthine and xanthine are not.
Maltose, d-mannose, trehalose, pyruvate and salicin are utilized, but cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-xylose, acetate, citrate, succinate, benzoate, l-malate, formate and l-glutamate are not.
Acid is produced from d-fructose, d-mannose, melezitose and trehalose, but not from melibiose or d-ribose.
Susceptible to cephalothin, chloramphenicol, novobiocin and oleandomycin, but not to gentamicin or polymyxin B.

In the API ZYM system, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI phosphohydrolase, α-glucosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase activities are present, but lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase activities are absent.
The major fatty acids (>10 % of total fatty acids) are iso-C15 : 0 and anteiso-C15 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 37.9 mol% (determined by HPLC).
Other phenotypic characteristics are given in Table 1.
The type strain, ISL-4T (=KCTC 12975T =CCUG 54354T), was isolated from a marine solar saltern of the Yellow Sea, Korea.
